newsitem.title: UK: Thorn shares slip on cautious outlook.
newsitem.headline: Thorn shares slip on cautious outlook.

text.p: Shares in newly demerged electrical rentals group Thorn Plc fell on Monday after the company's first half profits beat expectations but the company said difficult trading conditions would impact next year.
The shares fell 16p to 331-1/2p by 0920 GMT, despite pre-exceptional interim operating profits of 87 million stg, which beat a consensus forecast of 79 million stg.

Chief executive Mike Metcalf said Thorn was optimistic that profits would continue to improve despite competitive trading conditions in the U.S. and the delay in achieving cost efficiencies in the UK.
"However, these factors will have some impact on the outlook for the next financial year," he said.
